title: Make sure that Docker image can properly shutdown
body:
## Problem Definition

While trying to set up the proxy I noticed that the proxy didn't exit cleanly. 
Instead, it exited with (code=137). 

This might be because there is an infinite loop (intentional) monitoring the subprocesses, and this loop only exits if one of the subprocesses stops running.

This will cause the script to exit with code 1.

https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/53d36bc1f5aa0ff64fcfaf21f0ba6ca005a032eb/packaging/docker/entrypoint.py#L173

## Requirements

- Handle `SIGINT`/`SIGTERM` normally and exit cleanly (code=0)
- Make sure that if the subprocesses die we exit (code=1)

title: Querying trades of a single exchange that is ignored for sync should not pull data
body:
## Problem Definition

rotki has a setting for each CEX that is meant to ignore syncing data with that exchange. The problem is that in the trades querying view, the frontend asks trades for each exchange separately.

In our code the function that decides whether data needs to be pulled from the exchange respects the setting when it concerns all exchanges (it iterates only connected exchanges that are not ignored), but not when querying a single one directly.

https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/62540a0e094b4bf9f5be87876b84dae99dc31300/rotkehlchen/history/events.py#L125-L127

This needs to change.

### System Description
Operating system: Any 
Rotki version: 1.26.2

## Task

- [ ] Make it so that the ignore_sync setting is respected when querying a single exchange.
- [ ] Write a test for it
- [ ] See if there is any other places we should respec this setting and we are not doing so.

title: Provide an option not to automatically rescan balances with every modification
body:
## Abstract

In the current version, whenever I change an address name, or make a new tag, my whole portfolio is rescanned and while it's being rescanned, all options to change names or tags are greyed out until the scan is completed. This makes the app utterly unusable, as to change names or takes for 100+ addresses it can take many hours of waiting time. 

## Motivation

It'd be really great if the automatic rescanning is slightly delayed/postponed. For example, this is how some other crypto tax apps work: they have a grace period of a few minutes until your portfolio is recalculated, giving the user more time to add/update his data before scheduling a complete rescan and tax recalculation.

title: Detect all tokens is a no-op

labels.name: easy
labels.description: Easy issue. But maybe not good first. Fast if you are a bit familiar.

body:
## Problem Definition

The detect all tokens button does not do the work it's supposed to do in v1.26.1

![2022-11-23_00-52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1658405/203444734-681c0c71-5c68-4b21-bae6-ab4b9cf0bcef.png)

It's a no-op. The reason is that it's called by the frontend with `only_cache=True` so only the last known detected tokens are returned. The intention was to skip cache and actually detect tokens so it should be `only_cache=False`.

Additionally the backend should not count it as a token detection.

## Task

- [ ] Do not use `only_cache=True` on that button
- [ ] If `detect_tokens` is called with `only_cache=True` the last detection timestamp **should not be** updated

title: Ledger Actions ignored in PnL Calculation
body:
## Problem Definition

Some ledger actions are ignored for the "Tax Free PnL" / "Taxable PnL" columns of the profit and loss report.
As far as I have seen, this issue occurs if the asset/currency is EUR or USD, but not if the asset is ETH.

Example to reproduce:
1. Add a manual ledger action, e.g. an expense of 10 USD
2. Ensure that "taxable" is enabled for this ledger action in the settings
3. Generate a profit and loss report for the respective time period
4. The value of the ledger entry can be seen in the "taxable amount" column, but not under "taxable PnL"
5. The value is also not included in the total sum under "overview"
6. Go back to the ledger action and change the asset to ETH
7. Re-generate the PnL report
8. The expense is included in the PnL sum

Is this behavior intended? If not, could it be because no cost basis is evaluated for main currency?

On a side note, the total PnL values calculated for my rotki databases have changed in the last months (significantly, not just rounding errors), although I did not add any actions.
I did not see any entry in the changelog that could cause this. Did the PnL calculation change in the last months?

### System Description

Operating system: Windows 10
App Version: 1.25.3
Frontend Version: 1.25.3
Electron: 18.2.3

title: Use savepoints during globaldb updates
body:
At the moment we apply all the updates at once when the conflict method resolution has been chosen. This presents the issue where if the sql query is incorrect we can end up with missing assets. The reason for this is this delete statement https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/develop/rotkehlchen/globaldb/updates.py#L69 that is not rolled back at https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/develop/rotkehlchen/globaldb/updates.py#L353 and if we try to roll back we undo all the previous actions.

For this lefteris suggested that we use https://www.sqlite.org/lang_savepoint.html in the update process

title: Windows updater fails due to EPERM: operation not permitted
body:
## Problem Definition

Windows auto-update fails for users with `EPERM: operation not permitted, mkdir 'C:\Users\runneradmin'`

Now `runneradmin` is the user in the GitHub Actions that builds the application.

This should normally be `%USERPROFILE%` which would dynamically translate to the logged user's account, but it seems that somehow this gets interpolated during the build process and ends up with the `runneradmin` user hard-coded.

This results to the updater trying to download the update in the wrong user directory failing since it doesn't have permission to do so.

## Logs


```

title: urlencode and non-string values
body:
## Problem Definition

In various places in the code we are using urlencode. urlencode only encodes string or bytes values. This is something counter-intuitive for developer who would expect it to properly encode things like:

```python
True -> 'true'
False -> 'false'
None -> 'null'
```

In reality it just stringifies the above. So it does:


```python
True -> 'True'
False -> 'False'
None -> 'None'
```

## Task

Check all usages of urlencode() and make sure that it's used properly and only encodes string arguments. At least 1 place in coingecko uses booleans:

https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/13caf168311355f23eadb381197ef89db2a9f4f4/rotkehlchen/externalapis/coingecko.py#L432

This results in the value being ignored and for example all of our coingecko queries return all data that we do not require (social, internationalization etc).

Compare:
https://api.coingecko.com/api/v3/coins/ethereum?localization=False&tickers=False&market_data=False&community_data=False&developer_data=False&sparkline=False
https://api.coingecko.com/api/v3/coins/ethereum?localization=false&tickers=false&market_data=false&community_data=false&developer_data=false&sparkline=false

title: 30,000ms timeout at transactions query if there is too many addresses and transactions
body:
## Problem Definition

We have seen this happen with many transactions and many addresses. I could reproduce with my normal account if all transactions were unqueried. At some points something is starving the app and responses start taking too long which leads to timeouts.

We added some context switching in the transactions querying and etherscan code which helped but did not completely solve it: https://github.com/rotki/rotki/commit/9677b77115bebe5ffed46d981b0fd3ffdb8475b2

## Task

1. Figure out why this is happening and fix it. Figure out if it's a generic problem with having too many heavy-work greenlets or if there is indeed something blocking and starving the app. I suspect the latter by seeing also the logs black out (no log entries) for 15-25 seconds whenever this happens.

2. Make an issue (or confirm it exists) for our plans to offload heavy processing to a different process.

title: Disallow addition and editing of external trade that could result in invalid trade fees

labels.name: easy
labels.description: Easy issue. But maybe not good first. Fast if you are a bit familiar.

body:
## Problem Definition

At the moment it's possible to add an external trade through the API (or edit it) in a way that could result in invalid fees.

Specifically it seems that it's possible to have a fee but no fee currency which should not be possible.

We need to disallow this in the API and add a test for both add/edit that should fail.

## Task

The api code that adds a trade is here: https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/7f7478df40eb6b9397d3f0df945e23f0cc73a924/rotkehlchen/api/rest.py#L812

The api code that edits a trade is here:
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/7f7478df40eb6b9397d3f0df945e23f0cc73a924/rotkehlchen/api/rest.py#L847

1. We need to make sure that if fee or fee_currency is given both of them are given and not only one. Also that fee is not ZERO.
2. Add tests for this.
3. Also add a changelog entry.
4. Add a DB upgrade to go through existing trades and if fee_currency is missing then also make fee as null.

![2022-01-06_12-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1658405/148375126-ed18eb6f-5fe4-49e3-9903-b9013ae61f5e.png)


A user complained about their ethereum transactions page always stuck at loading. We checked the backend logs and could not find anything. After the user gave the DB and the password to check it I realized there is a frontend exception (we really really should find a way to detect them and ask the user to show them to us).

```
app.373fd3ff.js:1 ZodError: [

title: New rotki accounts made from vXX and on may not have a DB version set if opened only once
body:
## Problem Definition

After some changes we stopped writing the DB version in the DB for fresh accounts in their first run. The second run will write the current version to the DB.

That's since we bail here:
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/f58859e7ff9f59a59c2b12142b48754861da4867/rotkehlchen/db/upgrade_manager.py#L230

and not get to the end where the version is written here:
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/f58859e7ff9f59a59c2b12142b48754861da4867/rotkehlchen/db/upgrade_manager.py#L240-L245

Not having the actual current DB version written in the DB is quite problematic (even if it's just for the first run only) since this messes with DB upgrades.

Scenario:

1. User opens rotki v1.22.1 which has this bug, and does some stuff and closes it. Current DB is not written in the code.
2. If user downloads v1.23.0 which will contain DB upgrade v30->v31, during the DB initialization, DB upgrade will be totally skipped since rotki assumes latest DB if there is no setting set.
3. :boom: 

If in between 1 and 2 user opens rotki again we are safe. So this is kind of an edge case, but still possible to happen and a nasty bug which I think I introduced at some point.

### Task

- Find out at what point this bug was introduced, to know all affected DB versions. Figure out `XX`.
- Fix it. It's very easy.
- In develop, and specifically if there is no DB version set have some extra, but temporary code to sanity check the user DB and make sure that it is indeed the version we think. This can happen by checking if tables that exist after an upgrade, are there.

title: Manual liabilities are incorrectly counted in the net worth balance and in the history graph.
body:
## Problem Definition

Manual liabilities are incorrect in the dashboard net worth balance, and in the net worth history graph. There are two issues:

Liabilities which are not displayed in the dashboard (see #3724) are ignored completely. In the screenshot below, the net worth should be 570k: 595k of BTC minus the two USDC liabilities, 25k. However, it displays 585k. It's subtracting the liability amount from the dashboard, not the total amount.

Liabilities which are displayed in the dashboard are added to the net worth history graph instead of being subtracted. In the screenshot below, I took one snapshot. title: Delisted coinbase pro assets break rotki due to bad CoinbasePro API design

labels.name: exchange
labels.description: Issues related to integration with an exchange

body:
## Problem Definition

A user reported a failed coinbase pro query: 

`Failed query for Coinbase Pro: Error: Coinbase Pro GET query at https://api.pro.coinbase.com/fills?product_id=XRP-EUR&limit=100 responded with error status code: 400 and text: {"message":"product_id is not a valid product"}`

After investigation it turns out that coinbase/coinbasepro has delisted XRP.

https://help.coinbase.com/en/coinbase/trading-and-funding/cryptocurrency-trading-pairs/ripple-sec
![2021-09-21_21-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1658405/134238691-102bfdfd-05c2-4c36-8620-0eb235f3c03a.png)

The problem with this is that the delisted `product_id` exists for historical completed orders but when you try to query the fills endpoint with the `product_id` this error appears.

## Task

1. Fix it by getting all valid products at the beginning of the coinbase pro session and if the given product is not in there then DO NOT query for it.
2. Report this to coinbase pro. This means history of trades for delisted assets is no longer retrievable.

title: TaskManager stops working when the Windows locale is set to Turkish
body:
## Problem Definition

We managed to pinpoint the issue thanks to the user's help. It seems that the camel case converter doesn't ignore the locale as it should.

When the system locale is set to Turkish on Windows this results in a transformation of the `task_id` property to `taskİd` instead of `taskId`.

Thus when a new task is stored to the task state in vuex the `taskId` is undefined since the property had the wrong name.

### System Description


Operating system:  Windows 10 x64 (Turkish Locale)
Rotki version: v1.20.1

title: Upgrading DB from v26->v27 can fail if user balancer LP events stored in their DB
body:
## Problem Definition

A user who upgraded from v1.16.2 to v1.18.1 notified us that they saw a DB upgrade failure from v26->v27. Which means the app versions v1.17.2 to v1.18.0.

Turns out that for specific user DBs who have had some Balancer LP events detected and had both the balancer events and the balancer pools DB table populated the DB upgrade would fail, since the upgrade deletes the balancer pools table first, hence possibly hitting a constraint.

## Workaround

Workaround is rather easy. Download v1.17.0-v1.17.2, since that can open v26 DB, purge all uniswap and balancer data, and then open with v1.18.XX.

## Task

Fix the upgrade so that this does not occur even for this special case of users.

title: Improve Uniswap trades fetching using the graph
body:
## Problem Definition

Lefteris reported two transactions that were not executed by him but the receiver was one of his accounts 

https://etherscan.io/tx/0xb256ca16c1f0cef96b5fd94c84860473783ed6e1504792f10c4a8bd8113e60bd
https://etherscan.io/tx/0x54cf3ea57f7f23d53a7bd91c3920027131c6320ee089f7409a84f1c88577a4b0

## Logs

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5068010/122549489-d37c1a00-d032-11eb-979f-5920290f9b4f.png)

## Possible solution

Currently when scanning for an account we look in the `from` and `to` field of the swap information since if there are multiple steps in the router the address can appear in both places and some trades where missing before because of this.

A solution would be to see the number of executions made in the transaction and check when there are multiples if the sender is the account we are tracking. This wouldn't imply more queries since all of them should appear when iterating in the results

title: Bitcoin legacy xpub with too many used address may fail to query balances after restart
body:
## Problem Definition

If a user adds a legacy xpub that generates too many used addresses rotki will properly add the xpub and all its addresses. But then after a restart it will fail to query all balances again.

Error is:

```
Error at querying blockchain balances: bitcoin external API request for balances failed due to https://blockchain.info/multiaddr?active=XXXXXX
```

The failure is due to attempting to query all addresses from blockchain.info using the multiaddr endpoint which seems to have a non-documented limit.

blockchain.info errors with a 502 if too many bitcoin addresses are sent.

## Task

Fix it by experimenting and figuring out a safe limit.
Then apply that limit where we query for multiple legacy bitcoin addresses.

title: For some MacOS users rotki is stuck at "connecting to backend"
body:
## Problem Definition

This does not happen to all MacOS users. Two MacOS users have so far reported this. The frontend is running and stuck at "connecting to rotki backend".

Looking at the logs one can see that the backend has launched and is running fine. The frontend just never connects. Restarting does not help.

Thanks to some back and forth with the affected user we also know that the backend accepts api queries fine. They made a query to both the `/ping` and the `/version` endpoint succesfully.

## Experiments

### Give a wrong ip to coingecko

The user is technical and tried a few things:

> if i add this line to my /etc/hosts file
`69.171.250.35 api.coingecko.com`
>and clear dns cache
`sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder`

> app is working.
>I tried that a couple of times back and forth.
>When I have this line, i can see login screen.
>When I remove it, app is always in "connecting" screen.
>And in logs, i have a ping response this time (which i don't see when i remove this new invalid ip address line)
>but now i can make it work after a couple of restarts
>and i see this "ping" line in logs whenever it works
>otherwise it's not wokring
>and it also works sometimes without this facebook ip

From the above it seems like inability to connect to coingecko at start helps (sometimes). This makes no sense to me as the coingecko query should run under a greenlet, so it should be asynchronous.

## Logs

Backend is running. Api server is on. And logs just do the periodic tasks that don't need a logged in user.
[macos_stuck_rotkehlchen.log](https://github.com/rotki/rotki/files/6410387/macos_stuck_rotkehlchen.log)

Frontend is running and has launched the backend.
[macos_stuck_rotki_electron.log](https://github.com/rotki/rotki/files/6410390/macos_stuck_rotki_electron.log)

### System Description


Operating system: Macos Big Sur (and also Mojave)
Rotki version: v1.16.1


## Task

Figure out what's happening and fix it.

title: User ended up with a corrupt token entry in the DB after conflict during upgrade
body:
## Problem Definition

A user contacted us via email and shared some screenshots which gave funny errors when trying to find/insert a token which should have been added via the v1 assets upgrade. The user said they had it already locally but opted to solve the confict by choosing remote.

I got their global.db and it seems that something is wrong.

```
sqlite> SELECT * from assets WHERE identifier="_ceth_0xf1f955016EcbCd7321c7266BccFB96c68ea5E49b";
_ceth_0xf1f955016EcbCd7321c7266BccFB96c68ea5E49b|C|Rally|RLY|||rally-2||0xf1f955016EcbCd7321c7266BccFB96c68ea5E49b

sqlite> SELECT * from ethereum_tokens where address="0xf1f955016EcbCd7321c7266BccFB96c68ea5E49b";
sqlite> 
```
So the asset has an entry in the `assets` table and not in the `ethereum_tokens` table. 

## Task

Figure out how this could have happened and if it's something on our side fix.

title: PnL CSV export cost basis info error splits entry in two lines
body:
## Problem Definition

When exporting in CSV and specifically for the cost_basis column there is a bug that will split one CSV entry into two making rendering them both incorrect.

It's actually quite a simple bug. In the `to_string()` function of the cost_basis:

https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/c20564602f9608e10e300d94930e86f56c9f4d14/rotkehlchen/accounting/cost_basis.py#L131-L141

If a sell is matched with multiple buys, then they are separated by a comma due to the `",".join()` :sweat_smile: 

Which is bad, since comma is the default delimiting character in our CSV export

## Task

Fix it!

title: Balancer trades end up having the wrong rate
body:
## Problem Definition

As noticed by @kelsos balancer swaps, when turned into a trade have the inverse rate. Swaps are always treated as buys. And in a buy the rate is defined as:

```
All pairs should be in the form of ``BASECURRENCY_QUOTECURRENCY``. For a ``buy`` this means you are buying ``amount`` of the ``BASE`` currency at a price of ``rate`` ``QUOTE`` currency per ``BASE``. 
```

But it seems the backend balancer code calculates the rate as the inverse of what it should be.

## Task

Fix it.

title: Adding multiple ETH accounts simultaneously with one of them repeated show wrong balances
body:
## Problem Definition

This beauty was spotted by @alexvansande.

Trying to add multiple ethereum accounts as a comma separated list with any of them repeated, will end up repeating the tokens of the repeated accounts, as many times as they are in the comma separated list.

This needs an empty account and will only show the duplicated balances during that rotki run. If rotki is restarted balances resume to normal.

As an example let's try the following:

```
0x1047344D5b5B28caeF6443848144c9a1e42Bb514,0x93D0DD7a89a9c477842bEcF30B8Ec18Bf285A19A,0x1047344D5b5B28caeF6443848144c9a1e42Bb514
```
At the time of writing `0x1047344D5b5B28caeF6443848144c9a1e42Bb514` has 32 USDC. If you repeat it once in the list as done above, you will see 64 USDC in the dashoard.

The frontend seems to make 3 calls. One of them correctly returns an error:

```
{"result": {"status": "completed", "outcome": {"result": null, "message": "Blockchain account/s ['0x1047344D5b5B28caeF6443848144c9a1e42Bb514'] already exist"}}, "message": ""}
```

If you try to repeat that address 4 times you get 32*4 = 128 USDC

```
0x1047344D5b5B28caeF6443848144c9a1e42Bb514,0x93D0DD7a89a9c477842bEcF30B8Ec18Bf285A19A,0x1047344D5b5B28caeF6443848144c9a1e42Bb514, 0x1047344D5b5B28caeF6443848144c9a1e42Bb514, 0x1047344D5b5B28caeF6443848144c9a1e42Bb514
```

## Task

Fix it

title: Recognize assets from DeFi balances as early as possible - do not map them by symbol

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: This issue will need some refactoring work

body:
## Problem Definition

The DefiChad module which uses the zerion defi aggregator for many calls returns assets in a structure that contains general asset info but is not mapped to an actual asset in rotki. The structures are just an address/name/symbol combination:

https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/4fd6c0d734d38223f6cc4cf5e0d145da263e3208/rotkehlchen/chain/ethereum/defi/structures.py#L19-L30

The reason for this design was to show detected assets even if rotki does not support them (having an entry in all_assets.json).

The DefiChad module returns this data via the "query_defi_balances" function:
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/4fd6c0d734d38223f6cc4cf5e0d145da263e3208/rotkehlchen/chain/ethereum/defi/chad.py#L34-L37

That is aggregated with the rest of the actual balances in ` _add_account_defi_balances_to_token_and_totals`:
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/4fd6c0d734d38223f6cc4cf5e0d145da263e3208/rotkehlchen/chain/manager.py#L1098

But the problem is that the aggregation is done based on symbol. And if the symbol matching does not match the actual address then the token is skipped with a warning:

https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/4fd6c0d734d38223f6cc4cf5e0d145da263e3208/rotkehlchen/chain/manager.py#L1125-L1143

So for example `aDAI` v2 has the symbol `aDAI`. Same as `aDAI` v1 The code above tries to match it to `aDAI` and then sees the token address discrepancy, throws a warning and skips it.

Back when the code was written, matching on an address was not possible due to having a json mapping. Now we got a DB. This should be easily possible.

## Task

It's time to change the design here a bit. We now have a global DB of assets that can be dynamically populated for each user. The structures returned by DefiChad don't need to be like this anymore. There is no need to have a balance per token_address/name/symbol combo. Instead:

- [ ] We now dynamically generate a new global DB asset for each new such combo we encounter. This way we start dealing with native `EthereumToken` assets and not custom stuff from as early on as possible.
- [ ] This allows for inclusion of all such balances in the dashboard, the snapshots, the history etc. (downside: without oracle data we don't know value/price)

title: Add/edit/remove ledger action does not get commited to the DB until next commit

labels.name: easy
labels.description: Easy issue. But maybe not good first. Fast if you are a bit familiar.

body:
## Problem Definition

It's pretty amazing nobody noticed this so far, especially considering users do utilize ledger actions a lot. So both [add](https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/b7883aac6070c7cece4ec8ae1b854af24e3cebfd/rotkehlchen/db/ledger_actions.py#L133), [remove](https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/b7883aac6070c7cece4ec8ae1b854af24e3cebfd/rotkehlchen/db/ledger_actions.py#L151) and [editing](https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/b7883aac6070c7cece4ec8ae1b854af24e3cebfd/rotkehlchen/db/ledger_actions.py#L178) a ledger action does not commit to the DB.

At next commit they are included but ofcourse that can lead to serious problems if you don't commit to the DB soon after or close the application.

## Task

- [x] Write a test for these. Append db checks to the existing checks.
- [x] Fix it. Super simple. Just add a commit to the db in the end of the these functions.

Now here the million dollar question is what happens in that 30 second gap? ## Task Figure it out, and proceed with an appropriate fix

title: Xpub address derivation and balance queries for legacy xpubs no longer works correctly due to blockchain.info response format change.
body:
## Problem Definition

I just noticed it today due to a failing test [here](https://github.com/rotki/rotki/pull/2404/checks?check_run_id=1926740817).
It seems that blockchain.info changed the format of their responses for the endpoint we use and order is no longer guaranteed.

Which means we need to adjust our code that deals with blockchain.info.

## Task

Fix our code that deals with blockchain.info to not expect the returned addresses with the same order as they were given.

title: Errors retrieving KuCoin trades
body:
## Problem Definition

Received the following errors, when trades were being retrieved from the KuCoin exchange:

"Backend messages"
`Query history of kucoin exchange died with exception: Expected either FVal or int.. Check the logs for more details`

"Trades for KuCoin"
`Failed query for KuCoin: Error: The backend query task died unexpectedly: Expected either FVal or int.`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1310982/108278782-83a34a00-7149-11eb-85d3-9ec9e893486b.png)

Steps:

1. Added KuCoin exchange.
2. Switched to dashboard and saw KuCoin balances.
3. Clicked History -> Trades and the process began to retrieve the trades.
4. The "Backend messages" error appeared in the Notifications, after about a minute.
5. The "Trades for KuCoin" error appeared, after a couple of minutes.
6. Closed the application and restarted it, with Debug logging.
7. Clicked History -> Trades again and received the same errors. 


## Logs

Log files attached (but deleted from lefteris)

1. rotkehlchen.log
2. rotki_electron.log


### System Description


Operating system: Windows 10 64-bit
Rotki version: 1.14.0

title: Staked Cream price appears incorrectly
body:
In version 1.13.0 of Rotki the staked Cream price and logo appear incorrectly. The CRM's price and logo show up instead of CREAM's.

The previous version of Rotki was showing the price correctly but the logo was still incorrect.

I think cryptocompare is used as price oracle for CREAM.

title: Wrong Binance asset mapping for STX
body:
## Problem Definition

This was reported by a user via email. They own some STX in binance. For Rotki STX is Stox (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/stox) but in Binance it's another token not called Stacks (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/stack). We support it in Rotki as blockstacks (STX-2) so we just need to change the binance mapping.

## Task

Fix the binance mapping.

title: Adex channel withdraw does not show token and usd value
body:
## Abstract

This was noticed thanks to the adex test events test I added 2 days ago. Had to amend the test here: https://github.com/rotki/rotki/pull/2226/commits/694184127faa021940e22051be97f0b98912a59c

It seems that the channel id is missing from the `channel_id_token` mapping. So it means it does not appear in the fee rewards mapping.

The problem is that the channel withdraw token is now shown as None from the graph. No idea why. And this causes the logic to be unable to get a usd value of the token balance withdrawn from the adex channel.

## Task

Figure out why and fix it

title: Ledger action should export rotki identifier and not name to CSV

labels.name: easy
labels.description: Easy issue. But maybe not good first. Fast if you are a bit familiar.

body:

title: Exchange asset movement query dies with Sqlite Integer Overflow exception
body:
## Problem Definition

A user reported this error in v1.12.1 and provided logs. The logs are not included here for privacy reasons.

The user experienced this while generating a PnL report:

```
[24/01/2021 21:29:18 GMT] ERROR rotkehlchen.api.rest: Greenlet for task 8 dies with exception: Python int too large to convert to SQLite INTEGER.
Exception Name: <class 'OverflowError'>
Exception Info: Python int too large to convert to SQLite INTEGER
Traceback:
   File "src/gevent/greenlet.py", line 818, in gevent._greenlet.Greenlet.run
  File "rotkehlchen/api/rest.py", line 247, in _do_query_async
  File "rotkehlchen/api/rest.py", line 1256, in _process_history
  File "rotkehlchen/rotkehlchen.py", line 534, in process_history
  File "rotkehlchen/history/trades.py", line 157, in get_history
  File "rotkehlchen/exchanges/exchange.py", line 279, in query_history_with_callbacks
  File "rotkehlchen/utils/interfaces.py", line 115, in wrapper
  File "rotkehlchen/exchanges/exchange.py", line 245, in query_deposits_withdrawals
  File "rotkehlchen/db/dbhandler.py", line 2041, in add_asset_movements
  File "rotkehlchen/db/dbhandler.py", line 1857, in write_tuples
```

And by checking the logs one can also see the same exact exception in the scheduled query of bittrex history:

```
[24/01/2021 21:31:44 GMT] ERROR rotkehlchen.greenlets: Query trades of bittrex exchange died with exception: Python int too large to convert to SQLite INTEGER.
Exception Name: <class 'OverflowError'>
Exception Info: Python int too large to convert to SQLite INTEGER
Traceback:
   File "src/gevent/greenlet.py", line 818, in gevent._greenlet.Greenlet.run
  File "rotkehlchen/exchanges/exchange.py", line 279, in query_history_with_callbacks
  File "rotkehlchen/utils/interfaces.py", line 115, in wrapper
  File "rotkehlchen/exchanges/exchange.py", line 245, in query_deposits_withdrawals
  File "rotkehlchen/db/dbhandler.py", line 2041, in add_asset_movements
  File "rotkehlchen/db/dbhandler.py", line 1857, in write_tuples

[24/01/2021 21:31:44 GMT] ERROR rotkehlchen.user_messages: Query trades of bittrex exchange died with exception: Python int too large to convert to SQLite INTEGER. Check the logs for more details
```

## Task

Figure out why the hell this can happen when trying to add an asset movement to the DB and fix it. Assuming that everything goes in the correct part of the schema bittrex may have returned a very big integer for a timestamp? This is the only integer field of the asset movement schema:

```python
DB_CREATE_ASSET_MOVEMENTS = """
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS asset_movements (
    id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    location CHAR(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT('A') REFERENCES location(location),
    category CHAR(1) NOT NULL DEFAULT('A') REFERENCES asset_movement_category(category),
    address TEXT,
    transaction_id TEXT,
    time INTEGER,
    asset VARCHAR[10],
    amount TEXT,
    fee_asset VARCHAR[10],
    fee TEXT,
    link TEXT
);
"""
```

title: Binance futures wallet balances are not correctly returned
body:
## Problem Definition

With rotki v1.10.1 we don't return all futures balances. We only return the cross collateral future wallet balances as per their API docs here: https://binance-docs.github.io/apidocs/spot/en/#cross-collateral-wallet-user_data

It turns out they got 2 different complete APIs for the different types of futures which they introduced in [June](https://www.binance.com/en/support/articles/360044100832-New-Binance-Futures-API-Endpoint-With-10x-Performance-)

- The USDT margined futures API: https://binance-docs.github.io/apidocs/futures/en/#general-info
- The Coin margined futures API: https://binance-docs.github.io/apidocs/delivery/en/#general-info

## Task

- Query wallet balances of both apis and include them in the binance api call.


Open question: Should the cross collateral wallet still be there? My guess is yes unless a user complains that due to that double balances are counted.

title: Wrong balances returned when when calling ETH balances after force sync (download)

labels.name: premium
labels.description: Features/bugs that deal with the premium subscriptions

body:
## Problem Definition

To reproduce an empty account is needed that finished the balances queries and is in an idle state.
After that, you add premium keys and you do a force sync (download)

After the force sync, the frontend will do a reset of state, but it will not re-login. While this will run the balances calls again, the backend will reply instantly with the previously cached responses returning empty results for eth balances.

The response, in this case, is invalid since the new database actually has accounts and should return the balances of these accounts.

## Note
After discussing with @LefterisJP on discord this seems to not be fixable in an easy way on the backend. 
An alternative approach would be to notify the user that they will be forcefully logged out and they would have to religion in order to use their new database.

### Task
- Invalidate the cache when the database is replaced via force sync.

FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/tmp/lefteris/_MEI4E2fsg/rotkehlchen/data/uniswapv2_lp_tokens.meta'
2020-11-23T14:49:58Z <Greenlet at 0x7fef149a8a70: <bound method RestAPI._do_query_async of <rotkehlchen.api.rest.RestAPI object at 0x7fef1cd87090>>('_eth_module_query', 9, module='uniswap', method='get_balances', query_specific_balances_before=None, addresses=['0x8F1aa25822F4DE42089970c55E6Ab1111e134012', '0x)> failed with FileNotFoundError
```

## Mitigation

Users who are affected can temporarily mitigate this by the following steps:

### Navigate to the rotki data directory

Linux:
`cd .local/share/rotki/data/`
OSX:
`cd ~/Library/Application Support/rotki/data`
Windows
`cd %LOCALAPPDATA%`

In all of the above you can also simply navigate to the directory.

### Find or create the assets subdirectory

If there is no assets subdirectory, create one. If you have used rotki in the past it's probably already there.

And then get into it
`cd assets`

### Download the lp token files directly from our Github

If you are in the assets directory and assuming you have `wget` all you need to do is.

`wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rotki/rotki/develop/rotkehlchen/data/uniswapv2_lp_tokens.meta`

and

`wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rotki/rotki/develop/rotkehlchen/data/uniswapv2_lp_tokens.json`

If you don't know how to get them from the console then just open the links in the browser, download the files directly into the assets directory.

---

That's all it should now work properly. Please note that uniswap LP detection for free users takes very very long due to utilizing open nodes and querying the chain directly. For much faster queries, upgrade to premium.

## Task

To solve this we need to add the missing file in the packaged binary.

title: PoolTogether data in Defi Overview is not correct

labels.name: ETH DeFi
labels.description: A feature concerning Ethereum Decentralized Finance

body:
## Problem Definition

PoolTogether (https://app.pooltogether.com/) data is not correctly represented in the Defi overview. This is because the zerion SDK seems to return "PLT" as the token (which rotki recognizes as "Plutus Defi"), so it's returning an incorrect crypto icon and value in the user's profit currency.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27592/92018221-27906900-ed55-11ea-8c1a-948e738d8f03.png)


The real token depends on which pool (DAI or USDC) the user has deposited their funds into thus should be returned as plDAI or plUSDC, which are locked in value 1:1 to DAI and USDC respectively. Therefore the correct valuation here would be 45 plDAI = 45 USD = ~38 EUR.

Even if zerion returned the correct token names, though, the downside is that these tokens are not listed on coingecko or cryptocompare as they're not really "tradeable tokens" -- just proxies for DAI and USDC, so we cannot grab the icons and prices automatically. We will probably need to create aliases plDAI for DAI and plUSDC for USDC and then include the icons manually? 

Another option of course is that we develop our own submodule (e.g. using their subgraph https://thegraph.com/explorer/subgraph/pooltogether/pooltogether or by querying the relevant contracts) and ignore the zerion results for pooltogether.

More resources:
https://defimarketcap.io/protocol/pool-together
https://etherscan.io/accounts/label/pooltogether

title: Binance Deposits & Withdrawals queries need to be fixed to conform to 90day window

labels.name: exchange
labels.description: Issues related to integration with an exchange

body:
## Problem Definition
As per the Binance API https://binance-docs.github.io/apidocs/spot/en/#withdraw-history-supporting-network-user_data & https://binance-docs.github.io/apidocs/spot/en/#deposit-history-user_data , the time interval for requested data must be 0-90 days. Currently rotki does not split queries into 90-day increments and thus the query returns 0 results.



```
[01/09/2020 10:05:24 W. Europe Daylight Time] rotkehlchen.exchanges.binance: Binance API request request_url=https://api.binance.com/wapi/v3/withdrawHistory.html?timestamp=1598947524970&startTime=1598947182000&endTime=1598947524000&recvWindow=10000&signature=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
[01/09/2020 10:05:25 W. Europe Daylight Time] rotkehlchen.exchanges.kraken: Kraken Ledgers Query Response with count:0
```

## Solution
Queries to Binance for withdrawals / deposits must be split into 90 day increments.

With the addition of 'Location' to the csv export, I believe some of the formulae need updating. For example:

https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/4e1d6050b65dece9f002608fe738b09c5fb2b773/rotkehlchen/csv_exporter.py#L229

I think references to columns K and J should be to L and K, i.e.:

`taxable_profit_formula = '=IF(G{}=0,0,L{}-K{})'.format(row, row, row)`

Other examples:
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/4e1d6050b65dece9f002608fe738b09c5fb2b773/rotkehlchen/csv_exporter.py#L104
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/4e1d6050b65dece9f002608fe738b09c5fb2b773/rotkehlchen/csv_exporter.py#L107
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/4e1d6050b65dece9f002608fe738b09c5fb2b773/rotkehlchen/csv_exporter.py#L110
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/4e1d6050b65dece9f002608fe738b09c5fb2b773/rotkehlchen/csv_exporter.py#L276

title: Hide "Get Rotki Premium" when Premium is enabled at the same user session
body: After entering the correct API key/secret and enabling data sync, the menu bar still displays "Get Rotki Premium".  To a paid-up user this can be a minor annoyance because it feels like superfluous marketing for something which has already been paid.  So ideally that menu item should just be hidden after Premium is activated.

title: Additional scrollbar appears in spite of main.scss rule
body:
## Problem Definition

There appears to be an additional scrollbar on the `html` element even though in `main.scss` we specify that this shouldn't be happening.

title: Can't click on triangle at right-hand side of filter fields
body: There are a bunch filter fields in the Accounts & Balances section which each have a downwards-pointing triangle at their right-hand side.  When clicking in the filter field, a dropdown appears and the triangle rotates 180 degrees to point upwards.  This is nice, but it doesn't work when clicking directly on the downwards-pointing triangle - in that case nothing happens.  This violates standard UI conventions and is confusing (and presumably easy to fix).

title: There is no way to unset an ethereum node in the settings
body:
## Problem Definition

At the moment if you succesfully set an ethereum node and you want to unset it you can't really do it. The application only accepts another valid ethereum node connection.

## Task

Allow removing an ethereum node connection from the frontend settings.

This should work by adding a check for the empty string right before the attempt connect call here:
https://github.com/rotki/rotki/blob/268bd118f4e4ff3d750e5968694b8b1f8e0b1145/rotkehlchen/chain/ethereum/manager.py#L165

Something like this:

```python
        if endpoint == '':
            if self.web3:
                del self.web3
            self.connected = False
            self.ethrpc_endpoint = ''
```

In the frontend there should be some nice way to send the empty string, rather than simply deleting the endpoint string.

title: If asset of an account is same as main currency the displayed value is off due to double conversion
body:
## Problem Definition

This has been a long standing problem in Rotki's UI which we need to address.

If the main currency is the same as the asset of an account entry then the Fiat Value is wrong due to the double conversion of going from USD -> Main Currency Fiat. An example screenshot of the problem with EUR below:

![2020-04-29-175936_1019x112_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1658405/80618239-6038d280-8a43-11ea-8432-63a9a4e2437e.png)

## Task

The backend will always return USD values of each asset. Will not change this. But this should be easily addressable in the frontend. The Fiat value column should have a special rule added. In pseudocode:

```
if main_currency == entry.asset:
    display(entry.amount)
else:
    display(entry.usd_value * main_currency.exchange_rate)
```

Should be trivial to fix.

title: Creating a Kraken API connection with a Kraken user with no balances/transactions fails
body:
## Problem Definition

If the user has a Kraken account that is "empty" (no balances, trades, etc.) and they attempt to create a Kraken API connection with valid API keys, the following happens:
* The backend returns a 500 error to the client
* The user is unable to set up a Kraken connection from this point on as they get an error that Kraken is already registered (it appears as unregistered but providing credentials and clicking "setup" returns the "Exchange kraken is already registered" error).

This appears to happen because the API result from Kraken is malformed during the initial API connection from the backend, as it provides a response of `{'error': []}` which the backend doesn't know how to handle. As a result a 500 internal error occurs, no credentials are registered, but the exchange does appear to be registered (doing a manual GET call to the `/exchanges` endpoint will show this). Following this, the user must perform a manual DELETE call to the `/exchanges` endpoint to delete the erroneous `kraken` exchange before they can create a new connection via the client UI.

title: Tests Scripts do not run on Windows due to environment variable setting
body:
## Problem Definition

Due to the setting of environment variables, test scripts currently do not execute properly on Windows.

E.g.:
` "test:e2e": "CODE_COVERAGE=true vue-cli-service test:e2e",` in Windows would be:
` "test:e2e": "set CODE_COVERAGE=true && vue-cli-service test:e2e",`


## Solution

We can make separate scripts for Windows, or figure out how to use the .env files we have in the scripts with a cross-platform script command, or use a module like [cross-env](https://www.npmjs.com/package/cross-env) for cross-platform script commands with env variable setting.

title: Etherscan API key is not always used.
body:
## Problem Definition

There is a bug in the way etherscan calls are made. Half of the calls don't actually use the provided API key which makes the chain querying experience very slow.

## Task 

Fix it.

title: Adding manually tracked asset for which no price can be found breaks all manually tracked assets
body:
## Problem Definition

This issue is also reported in Rotki v1.4.0 by @cryptomole1

Adding a manually tracked asset for which Rotki can't find a cryptocompare price will result in a 502 error by the API, which is fine and expected, since we can't find a price for the asset.

But the next time the application is loaded and Rotki tries to load the manually tracked balances the entire api call to query them fails and no manually tracked balances are shown in the table.

## Task

- Fix the bug
- Write a test

title: Changing fiat currency does not change manually tracked balances value column title
body:
## Problem Definition

Seen in v1.4.0 by @cryptomole1

Changing the FIAT currency via the drop-down menu if the user has manually tracked balances changes the value but not the title of the column. The title of the column is stuck to being `USD Value`.

I can confirm the problem, just tested it.

## Task

- Fix it
- Write a unit test

title: Calling endpoint balances/blockchains/btc causes an internal server error
body:
## Problem Definition

Making an API call to `balances/blockchains/btc` when you have no BTC wallets/addresses assigned to the current user causes an internal server error whereas it should return a standard API response with result containing empty `per_account` and `totals` objects.

**Steps to reproduce:**
* Make a simple HTTP GET call to `http://127.0.0.1:5042/api/1/balances/blockchains/eth`, you should get a response like:
``{"result": {"per_account": {}, "totals": {}}, "message": ""}``

* Make a simple HTTP GET call to `http://127.0.0.1:5042/api/1/balances/blockchains/btc`, you will get the response:
``{"message": "Internal Server Error"}``

On next startup, the app pops up the attached error after ~5 seconds. Terminating the rotkehlchen-1.1.1-windows.exe process resolves the issue.

Tested on Windows 10 Pro x64 Build 1909

Provide a description of what is the current problem and why you are raising this issue.

Rotkehlchen also logs debug information to the `rotkehlchen.log` file. Please attach it to the

title: Cached user-specific data should go in the user directory
body:
## Problem Definition

At the moment all cached data are in the general rotkehlchen data directory (in Linux by default: `~/.rotkehlchen/`). That works for price and historical price caches but will not work for user trade/action history caches.

As long as someone has two user accounts they will share the same user history caches which can lead to rather unpredictable behaviour.

## Task

Make sure that all user specific data are cached in the user directory and not in the share rotkehlchen data directory.

title: Selling an asset that will fork prefork time should also reduce its bought amount

labels.name: Affects P/L Calculation
labels.description: Bugs/Changes that affect the profit/loss calculation of rotkehlchen

body:
## Problem Definition

For assets that will fork, like `ETH` pre-`ETC` fork and `BTC` pre-`BCH` fork at the moment rotkehlchen adds equal amount of the after-fork asset for every buy before the fork happens. Logic is [here](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/3e51f3a3d90982f60fd314338185d714cc2a794d/rotkehlchen/accounting/events.py#L92).

But that can lead to the user having more of the forked asset for selling than in reality since rotkehlchen currently does not also reduce the amount for every sell of the original asset pre fork.

## Task

- [ ] Adjust the prefork acquisition logic to also reduce the forked asset for every sell of the original asset pre-fork.
- [ ] Write tests for this

title: Incorrect trades profit/loss due to FIFO cost error

labels.name: price querying
labels.description: Related to current or historical price querying

labels.name: Affects P/L Calculation
labels.description: Bugs/Changes that affect the profit/loss calculation of rotkehlchen

body:
## Problem Definition

For the trades profit/loss there can be an error when calculating the trades profit loss (both taxable and non taxable) due to the function [search_buys_calculate_profit()](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/855a4004b97c8ad6cb49579a9dbc11f33254988d/rotkehlchen/accounting/events.py#L499) returning incorrect `taxable_bought_cost` and `taxfree_bought_cost` under some specific conditions.

When going back through the FIFO list of `BuyEvent`s when an entire trade is consumed the code currently [uses](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/855a4004b97c8ad6cb49579a9dbc11f33254988d/rotkehlchen/accounting/events.py#L560) the `trade.cost` to calculate the taxable and non taxable bought amount cost.

1. The first problem is when the trade was touched before in the queue and had its amount reduced since it was used by another sell. If it was touched before and the current sell does not take up the entire buy the right thing [is](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/855a4004b97c8ad6cb49579a9dbc11f33254988d/rotkehlchen/accounting/events.py#L530) done and the `bought_cost` takes the remaining amount multiplied by the rate into account. But if the current sell takes up the entire `BuyEvent` then we use the entire [cost](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/855a4004b97c8ad6cb49579a9dbc11f33254988d/rotkehlchen/accounting/events.py#L560) which is a mistake and can lead to an overall incorrect trades profit/loss calculation.

2. There is an additional problem if a buy is exactly consumed by 1 sell then the current implementation [doesn't](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/855a4004b97c8ad6cb49579a9dbc11f33254988d/rotkehlchen/accounting/events.py#L515) properly [set](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/855a4004b97c8ad6cb49579a9dbc11f33254988d/rotkehlchen/accounting/events.py#L529) the `stop_index` and as such rotkehlchen ends up thinking that no buy was found and [returns](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/855a4004b97c8ad6cb49579a9dbc11f33254988d/rotkehlchen/accounting/events.py#L586) all 0s which burden the user with no taxable bought cost for the buy.

## Task

- [x] Fix the first issue by taking `rate` * `remaining_amount` as the cost in the case where the entire trade is consumed.

- [x] Fix the second issue by properly setting the `stop_index` if a buy is exactly consumed by a single sell and make sure the old buy is deleted.

- [x] Make unit tests for the trades fifo queue search when the 2 condition described in this issue happen

title: Setting tax_free_period to "No" crashes rotkehlchen at restart
body: As discovered by @nhultz here: https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/pull/196 I stumbled upon this bug when working on adding the gas costs option to the Account settings. I managed to break my login account because of the `tax free after period` setting. It looks like when the option is set to `No`, it sends a null value to the backend and the database code doesn't handle getting a `None` value for this setting when looking up the settings again. This little hotfix makes it so the settings code can handle the `None` and the front-end will correctly display Yes or No when this option is set. **Steps to Reproduce:** - Create a new account - Go to the Accounting Settings screen - Change the tax free after period setting to `No` - Hit the `Set` button and save the settings to the database. - Everything will be fine at first but the next time you try to log in, you get this error:

title: Exchange page table doesn't work

title: Ethereum node connection indicator should not change to connected after some time
body:
## Problem Definition

After some time passes, even without actually having an ethereum node to connect to, the ethereum node connection indicator changes to connected as shown in the screenshot.

![rotk_connected_to_node](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1658405/46572807-2816fe00-c98c-11e8-9b70-427d18ff7312.png)


This should not be happening and needs to be fixed.

## Task

The problem lies in the way the `add_alert_dropdown()` [function](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/fd25217aad3bc945d1df3e7869da520c62c00c5a/ui/dashboard.ts#L146) handles it.

It periodically checks the log for a specific message and sets the connected icon to true if the error is not in the log or to false if it's in the log. Since it tails the log, it will see the error once, set it to false, but at next time the tail data are processed it will have moved to another part of the log and it will no longer see it and set it back to true.

For this issue the quick fix is to simply remove the else statement [here](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/blob/fd25217aad3bc945d1df3e7869da520c62c00c5a/ui/dashboard.ts#L151).

----

For a more proper issue the log watching and tailing should simply go away and the client should be queried for this information. There is already [an issue](https://github.com/rotkehlchenio/rotkehlchen/issues/131) for this.

title: If there is 0 balance across all entries, querying for total balance fails.
body:
## Problem Definition

In the event that there is a balance of `0` across all entries (exchanges, fiat balances, blockchain e.t.c.) then the backend greenlet that queries for the overall balances crashes and never returns a response to the frontend.

Log entries:
```
06/10/2018 12:59:56 CEST -- INFO:rotkehlchen.rotkehlchen:query_balances called requested_save_data=False
06/10/2018 12:59:56 CEST -- INFO:rotkehlchen.rotkehlchen:query_fiat_balances called
06/10/2018 12:59:56 CEST -- ERROR:rotkehlchen.server:Greenlet for task 2 dies with exception: [<class 'decimal.DivisionUndefined'>].
Exception Name: <class 'decimal.InvalidOperation'>
Exception Info: [<class 'decimal.DivisionUndefined'>]
Traceback:
   File "src/gevent/greenlet.py", line 716, in gevent._greenlet.Greenlet.run
  File "/home/lefteris/w/rotkehlchen/rotkehlchen/server.py", line 101, in _query_async
    result = getattr(self, command)(**kwargs)
  File "/home/lefteris/w/rotkehlchen/rotkehlchen/server.py", line 229, in query_balances
    result = self.rotkehlchen.query_balances(save_data)
  File "/home/lefteris/w/rotkehlchen/rotkehlchen/rotkehlchen.py", line 518, in query_balances
    'percentage_of_net_value': (total / net_usd).to_percentage(),
  File "/home/lefteris/w/rotkehlchen/rotkehlchen/fval.py", line 105, in __rtruediv__
    return FVal(self.num.__rtruediv__(other))
```

It's essentially a division by zero.

## Task

Take into account the posibility of 0 balance and act accordingly in the backend to avoid division by zero.

title: If an error occurs on the python backend during tax report calculation, the app will hang forever
body:
## Problem Definition

If a python backend error happens during the calculation of the tax report, then because the call to the backend is made in an asynchronous way we have no way of detecting that something went wrong and the application will always be stuck at the "Loading..." stage

## Task

Somehow catch all errors that may happen during the tax report or periodically check for errors. If an error happens, then make sure to stop the process and notify the user.

title: BTG or other assets with no market in bittrex crash the app

labels.name: exchange
labels.description: Issues related to integration with an exchange

body:
## Problem Definition

If a user holds an asset in bittrex that does not have a market in the exchange, like say `BTG`, then during balances query rotkehlchen will crash with `ValueError: Bittrex: Could not find BTC market for "BTG"`

## Task

Fix the crash, and use other sources for market price data in the case this happens.

    except SystemExit as e:

            logging.critical(tb)

            sys.exit(e.code)
